intro: Rinorea congesta, commonly known as the clustered rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Rinorea congesta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and continuous flowering habit.
